Use the templates below to enter your data:

<br>
- [Taxonomy quality check with WoRMS](protocols/WoRMS_quality_check.pdf)
<br>
<br>
Use these instructions to upload you data to the [MBON Pole to Pole IPT](http://ipt.iobis.org/mbon/):
<br>
- [HOW TO upload data to the Integrated Publishing Toolkit](https://diodon.github.io/P2P_documents/PublishData/docs/PublishingDataIPT.html)
<br>
<br>
Try this [code](https://github.com/marinebon/p2p-dashboard) to develop [Biodiversity Dashboards](https://marinebon.org/p2p-dashboard/biodivExplorer_beach.html#general-information) for your monitoring sites 
<br>

Try this [code](http://rpubs.com/eqmh/lme-obis-extractions) to visualize boundaries of selected Large Marine Ecosystems (LMEs) and extract [OBIS](http://obis.org) records from selected [LMEs](http://lme.edc.uri.edu/index.php/digital-data)
<br>
<br>
<img width="1000px" src="images/lme_extractions.jpg"/>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
Try this [code](https://rpubs.com/eqmh/sat-data-plotter-mapper) to extract sea surface temperature (SST) and chlorophyll-a (CHL) from [ERDDAP](https://coastwatch.pfeg.noaa.gov/erddap/index.html) servers for particular location, create time series plots of [SST](https://rpubs.com/eqmh/sst_ts_Patag) and [CHL](https://rpubs.com/eqmh/chla_ts_Patag_v2) and their [climatologies](https://rpubs.com/eqmh/sst_climatology_plot), and generate a map with the latest satellite data.
